medical_history.chief_complaint: Short stature with deficiencies of GH, TSH, PRL, LH, and FSH.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Growth failure was first noticed at the age of 1.5 years. At 4.9 years, the patient had a height of 92.5 cm (23.1 sd) and severe bone age retardation at 2.5 years. After starting treatment with levo-T4 and recombinant GH, catch-up growth was adequate. At 14.1 years, her height was 150.0 cm (21.5 sd) and further hormonal evaluations confirmed deficiencies.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Combined pituitary hormone deficiency (CPHD) due to homozygosity for a novel mutation (F88S) in the PROP-1 gene.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are first cousins; both parents are heterozygous for the F88S mutation but clinically normal. The patient has two older sisters with normal heights and spontaneous puberty.
